contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Yui |JapaneseName= 由比町 |MapImage=Yui in Shizuoka Prefecture.png |Since=November 1, 2008 |Currently=[[Shimizu-ku, Shizuoka|Shimizu-ku]], [[Shizuoka, Shizuoka|Shizuoka]] |Region=[[Chūbu region]] ([[Tōkai region]]) |Prefecture=[[Shizuoka Prefecture|Shizuoka]] |District=[[Ihara District, Shizuoka|Ihara District]], |Area=23.03 |PopDate=October 1, 2008 |Population=9,085 |Density=394.5 |Tree= [[Osmanthus]] |Flower= [[Sakura]] |Bird= [[uguisu]] |Coord={{coord|35|6|N|138|34|E|region:JP_type:city|display=inline}} |CityHallLink= }} {{nihongo|'''Yui'''|由比町|Yui-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ihara District, Shizuoka|Ihara District]], [[Shizuoka Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On November 1, 2008, Yui [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan|was merged]] into [[Shimizu-ku, Shizuoka|Shimizu-ku]], a ward in the city of [[Shizuoka, Shizuoka|Shizuoka]]. Because of this and another merger, [[Ihara District, Shizuoka|Ihara District]] dissolved.<ref name="Plannedmerge">http://www.kokudo.or.jp/new/cities/sub/chubu/22.htm</ref> At the time of its merger, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 9,085 and a [[population density|density]] of 394.5 persons per km². The total area was 23.03 km². == Town outline == Yui was well known for {{nihongo|''cherry shrimp''|桜海老|sakura-ebi}}, a small variety of shrimp found in [[Suruga Bay]]. Yui's flag displayed the character "由" to represent the town and 12 stamens; one for each of the wards. These are contained within orange blossoms, a special product of Yui. Around the flower, a seagull represents peace and equality. Yui's symbols were the bush warbler, fragrant olive, and cherry blossoms. The town had two elementary schools and one junior high school. Yui is served by [[Yui Station]] on the [[Tōkaidō Main Line]]. ==References== {{reflist}} [[Image:Tokaido53 Yui.jpg|thumb|left|The countryside around Yui in the 1830s, as depicted by [[Hiroshige]] in [[The Fifty-Three Stations of the Tōkaidō]]]] {{Shizuoka-geo-stub}} [[Category:Populated places disestablished in 2008]] [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Shizuoka Prefecture]]
